text: Slovo (, 'Word') was a daily newspaper published in Bulgaria 1922-1924. The newspaper fiercely opposed the Aleksandar Stamboliyski government and the communist movement. Aleksandar Grekov served as director of the newspaper. After Grekov was assassinated, Prof. Milev took over the editorship of Slovo. ==References== Category:Newspapers published in Bulgaria Category:1922 establishments in Bulgaria Category:1924 disestablishments Category:Bulgarian- language newspapers Category:Publications established in 1922 Category:Publications disestablished in 1924
title: Slovo (newspaper)
